ComicInfo.Title: The Corpse That Came to Dinner; The Human Hyena of Pirra; The Horror of Candle Lodge; Battle of Edge Hill; Till Death Do Us Part; Gunnvor the Sorceress; Hanged by the Neck; The Spanish Steed
ComicInfo.Summary:
The Corpse That Came to Dinner: A young couple returns from their honeymoon. They learn that a friend has committed suicide, because he had wanted to marry the girl. The friend's corpse climbs out of his grave and lays siege to the couple's apartment.
The Human Hyena of Pirra: Hunter shoots a were-hyena in Northern Africa.
The Horror of Candle Lodge: Ghost of US-American freedom fighter slays the descendants of British soldiers who lured him into a trap.
Battle of Edge Hill: Eye-witnesses confirm the "fata morgana" of a ghost battle in the sky.
Till Death Do Us Part: Charles finds out that her sister's husband is keeping him from his inheritance by pretending the sister still to be alive. She died some time ago and is paraded through town as a veiled mummy.
Gunnvor the Sorceress: Account of Icelandic saga about madwoman Gunnvor, who could not be killed and haunted her people in many different shapes.
Hanged by the Neck: The magician El Rondo grows jealous of his assistant and hangs him on stage (during a magic routine). Haunted by the man's ghost, El Rondo meets his fate getting paid back in kind.
The Spanish Steed: Wanting to tame a legendary gray stallion, a sportsman is suddenly faced with a centaur.
